definition: low/beneath/to lower (one's head)/to let droop/to hang down/to incline

sentences.english: Candle shadow inside, sees yarn debt droop, before the bed one big one small two pairs of shoes.
sentences.chinese: 燭影裏，只見紗帳低垂，牀前一大一小兩對鞋子。

sentences.english: His head drooped down and a few minutes later he fell asleep.
sentences.chinese: 他低垂着腦袋，一會兒工夫就睡着了。

sentences.english: When saying these words, Yihe was looking iron gray, eyes casting down.
sentences.chinese: 說這些話時，一禾面色鐵灰，眼簾低垂。

sentences.english: The branches hung down to the ground with the weight of the apples.
sentences.chinese: 果實累累的蘋果樹枝低垂到地面。

sentences.english: The branches of the willows drooped over the water.
The pines bowed low in the storm.
The willow leaves shriveled, drooping like hanging rags.
sentences.chinese: 沙柳葉子蔫了，低垂下來，好像一條條灰色的碎布。

sentences.english: With a kiss and a tear on thy drooping brow.
sentences.chinese: 留一吻一淚於你低垂的眉間。
他因疲倦而低垂着雙肩。

sentences.english: Here there is low-hanging fruit ripe for the picking.
sentences.chinese: 這裏有一個低垂的成熟果實等待摘取。

sentences.english: I have posted the pictures of Kuching old court house at night before.
sentences.chinese: 我之前曾貼過古晉舊法庭在夜幕低垂時的圖片。

sentences.english: Before my eyes nocturnal curtains fall.
sentences.chinese: 在我雙眼的夜幕低垂之前。
低垂的雲霧籠罩着機場。

sentences.english: So when it was dark, I started to cook supper in the woods.
sentences.chinese: 因此夜幕低垂後，我開始在林中煮晚餐。

sentences.english: Born to higher things, here I droop my wings, ah!
sentences.chinese: 啊，我出生高貴，卻在此雙翼低垂。

sentences.english: First, comes a group of shuffling people, heads bowed.
sentences.chinese: 首先緩慢走來的一羣人，頭部低垂。

definition: (of a breeze) to make (hair, leaves, clothing etc) sway gently/to ruffle
to gaze at/to stare fixedly at
